com.wizarpos.devices.idcard
Interface IDCardControl

All Superinterfaces:
DeviceControl
public interface IDCardControl
extends DeviceControl

IDCardControl defines methods available to ID card reader.

This control is required by DeviceManager

IDCard device is an exclusive device. It can't be opened again if it's already opened.

Version:
July 01, 2013
Author:
Haiqing Jin

Method Detail

open

void open(int logicalID)
          throws DeviceException
Connect the ID card device.

Parameters:
logicalID - logical ID of the device to open.
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException -
  • if the logicalID is invalid.
  • if the mode is invalid.

listenForScanTargets

void listenForScanTargets(OperationListener listener)
                          throws DeviceException
Scan the ID card within the field.

This is an asynchronous method. handleResult(IDCardOperationResult) will be invoked when at least one card has been detected in the field.

Information about successfully detected Targets can be retrieved by the function IDCardOperationResult.getIDCard(). The values returned by these functions are only valid until the next call to scanTargets, or the close method.

The device receiving this request MUST be able to successfully respond to cancelRequest() and abort the operation.

Parameters:
timeout - the maximum scanning time of the method, in milliseconds.
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if timeout is invalid.

waitForScanTargets

IDCardOperationResult waitForScanTargets(int timeout)
                                         throws DeviceException
This is the synchronous method of the listenForScanTargets(OperationListener).

The values returned by these functions are only valid until the next call to waitForScanTargets or listenForScanTargets, or the close method.

Because this method uses a timeout parameter, the service receiving this request MUST be able to successfully respond to cancelRequest() and abort the operation.

In case of a timeout occurring, the operation event will contain status= EVT_ERROR and info=ERR_TIMEOUT, and no information about Targets will be available.

Parameters:
timeout - the maximum scanning time of the method, in milliseconds.
Returns:
the Targets of scanning. null if scanning timeout.
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if timeout is invalid.
